text: Hi All! Having some real issues with performance. Terrible scores 15/100 on Page Speed Insights. I can see embedding youtube videos is causing a lot of performance issues. (Tried vidyard too but similar results) Anyone got any tips on improving performance on embedding youtube vids? :slightly_smiling_face:

I just discovered a BUG (I think) when using ASYNC to include a CSS file.  When this `{ async: true }` is present it jacks up the CMS.

When attempting to drag in new module, they won't immediately render in the editor view but will show up in the CONTENTS tab.  I'm unable to delete a module in the editor view, only the CONTENTS TAB.

As a test, the main-foot.css file referenced in the screenshot below is empty. Nothing it in at all. Yet as soon as I add ASYNC the CMS goes wonky.

Anyone else used ASYNC with CSS and had success?

CC: <@U7SL518D6>
You can't async a css file as far as I know.
Unless I'm off

I love the upload feature in the design manager but I noticed I cannot upload Icons (.ico) or EOT (.eot) IE Fallback font files. Just wanted to see if anyone noticed any other file extensions that were blocked?
It's in their dev docs.
Hmm.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#require-css>
strange issue. I’ll DM you
I'm guessing it uses js to do so.
yep - it does <https://web.dev/defer-non-critical-css/#optimize|this>

<https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Preloading_content>
this might be a better solution
I'm sure there is a bug if it's causing the editor to freak
<@U504BHZ6K> do you mean by not using not using HubL  to load CSS and do it the standard way?
I've used this before. `<link rel="stylesheet" href="/path/to/my.css" media="print" onload="this.media='all'">`
Got it from the filiment group
async and preload are different concepts. both are performance optimizations, and technically you don’t need to use them separately from eachother.
Async however should not be causing the page editor issue. so anyhow as noted in the other thread. I’ll DM you about this Kevin
Also you shouldn't overuse preload because it is literally preloading everything so it could slow down your page load speeds if you use it too much
Yeah, preload can be a bit of a double edged sword. For example it’s possible to preload an entire other page within your page and all of it’s resources.
Instead I like to use pre-connect it works better because it reduces amount of time it takes to do an HTTP request to a URL that is associated with a CSS or JavaScript file

Has anyone seen lately where you load a page to create or edit, the default styling from the theme template loads (background colors, padding, etc) but then the styling goes away after a couple seconds? I’ve been seeing this sometimes, and although the edit view looks jacked, the actual page / preview looks correct. What would cause this?
this is rolled back now
Anyone?

Hello, this is my first question on the HubSpot slack, so I apologize if my question is wrongfully placed.

I have a need to set my x-frame-options header to allow specific domains. The CMS only gives the option to ‘deny’ or ‘same-origin’. Does anyone know a way to implement this outside of the cms?

Hey y'all. Got a question, I thought that HubSpot generated a srcset when using image? I have two images here, one is a default image module and the other is in a custom module with an image field. Neither  are generating a srcset. Any ideas? <https://8767341.hs-sites.com/>
<@U7SL518D6> I've seen you talk about this before
You are all a class acts. Thanks!

I’m chatting with the engineers but it appears right now the <http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com> domain will not get srcsets generated but once published to a domain you will get the srcsets.

I’m not sure if this is intentional right now and will update our documentation to be clear if it is.
If you are seeing drastic effects like that and you’re sure it is not your code causing it, you should <https://help.HubSpot.com/|contact support>.
k will do. Thanks!
<@U7SL518D6> Any insight on this one? Thanks!

I believe that’s an old old version of the chat widget
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/chat-widget-sdk>

If your site has the HS tracking code installed the conversations widget can be initiated from that instead.

so you wouldn’t need to separately embed it
Thanks what I figured. I hadn’t seen that before so wanted to clarify. Thank you!
ahhh good to know, thanks Jon
Any chance someone can help me with this?
I would suggest to upload custom fonts to the file manager instead of the design manager. Copy the URL, create a font-face in your css, works perfectly
